comment:
Low extraction?
I intended to do a three-step mash: 140, 156, 168; however, I doughed in too hot; I fumbled with the water to get the mash settled at 153; this dropped to 148 in the 60 minute mash time; oh well, each batch I learn/remember more.
Made a starter at 5 p.m. today using Wyeast Thames Valley Ale.

...avoid the temptation of using a higher extracting malt, such as a German Pils, or a Marris Otter; the dryish character that the Canadian grains contribute to N. American profile is what makes this beer!
...i hate predictive text! The "it's" in the previous post was supposed to be "its."

June 2014
2-row malt will be used for it's diastatic power; this should provide a highly attenative wort; perhaps it will increase the extraction too.
...too much water, and no OG reading!
